page.title: 20CHANGING TIMES IN OFFLEY.
page.content: The First and Second World Wars brought great changes to Offley as they did to the rest of the country. Farming methods perforce were changed, labourers were no longer content with their lot.Mechanisation on the farms meant that fewer men were needed to work the land.The local people looked elsewhere for employment,transport was available to take them daily into Luton or Hitchin. Offley became a main thoroughfare between Hitchin and Luton and the steep hill became a bottleneck on the A 505 until a by-pass was built. The Luton straw hat industry declined as foreign competition increased but other industries came to take its place.The Vauxhall Car Company and the airport at Luton now provide employment for many of the local people.
